question: Which among the following correctly defines the meaning of the Parliament?
option2: President, Prime Minister and other Ministers
option3: President, Rajya Sabha and Lok Sabha
option4: President, Chief Justice and Lok Sabha
answer: President, Rajya Sabha and Lok Sabha
explanation:
The Parliament of India is the supreme legislative body of the Republic of India. It is a bicameral legislature composed of the President of India and the two houses: the Rajya Sabha (Council of States) and the Lok Sabha (House of the People). Indian Parliament consists of the following three:
• Lok Sabha (House of the people)
• Rajya Sabha (House of the elders)
• Rashtrapati (President of India)
